alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 15 at 8:26AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River at Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. James River at Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, water reaches the base of the levee at Columbia Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Friday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 17 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday.
